indicators.name: Moving Average (SMA/EMA)
indicators.description: The baseline for price trends.
indicators.usage: Price above SMA = Uptrend. Price below SMA = Downtrend.

indicators.name: Bollinger Bands
indicators.description: Measures price relative to volatility; 'squeeze' indicates big moves.
indicators.usage: Price touching upper band = Overbought. Lower band = Oversold. Squeeze = Breakout impending.

indicators.name: Ichimoku Cloud
indicators.description: A comprehensive Japanese trend-following system (Kumo).
indicators.usage: Price above Cloud = Bullish. Below Cloud = Bearish. Cloud thickness indicates support/resistance strength.

indicators.name: ADX (Average Directional Index)
indicators.description: Measures the strength of a trend regardless of direction.
indicators.usage: ADX > 25 = Strong trend. ADX < 20 = Weak trend/Ranging.

indicators.name: Parabolic SAR
indicators.description: Identifies potential reversals in trending markets.
indicators.usage: Dots below candle = Uptrend. Dots above candle = Downtrend.

indicators.name: SuperTrend
indicators.description: A simplified trend-following indicator based on ATR.
indicators.usage: Green line below price = Global Buy signal. Red line above price = Sell signal.

indicators.name: MACD
indicators.description: Gauges trend strength and momentum shifts.
indicators.usage: Signal line crossover = Entry/Exit signal. Histograms show momentum strength.

indicators.name: ATR (Average True Range)
indicators.description: The gold standard for measuring market volatility and setting stops.
indicators.usage: High ATR = High volatility. Used to calculate Stop Loss distance.

indicators.name: Keltner Channels
indicators.description: Volatility-based envelopes similar to Bollinger Bands but uses ATR.
indicators.usage: Price closing outside channel = Strong trend continuation.

indicators.name: Chaikin Volatility
indicators.description: Compares the spread between high and low prices.
indicators.usage: Rising volatility often marks widespread distribution (tops) or panic (bottoms).

indicators.name: Standard Deviation
indicators.description: The mathematical foundation for measuring price dispersion.
indicators.usage: High Std Dev = High volatility (Risk). Low Std Dev = Consolidation.

indicators.name: RSI (Relative Strength Index)
indicators.description: Identifies overbought or oversold conditions.
indicators.usage: > 70 = Overbought (Sell risk). < 30 = Oversold (Buy opportunity).

indicators.name: Stochastic Oscillator
indicators.description: Compares a closing price to its price range over time.
indicators.usage: > 80 = Overbought. < 20 = Oversold. Crossovers signal reversals.

indicators.name: CCI (Commodity Channel Index)
indicators.description: Measures deviations from the statistical mean.
indicators.usage: > +100 = Strong Uptrend. < -100 = Strong Downtrend.

indicators.name: Williams %R
indicators.description: A momentum indicator that measures overbought/oversold levels.
indicators.usage: 0 to -20 = Overbought. -80 to -100 = Oversold.

indicators.name: Rate of Change (ROC)
indicators.description: Pure momentum measuring the percentage change in price.
indicators.usage: Positive and rising = Acceleration. Negative = Deceleration.

indicators.name: Money Flow Index (MFI)
indicators.description: A 'Volume-weighted RSI' that shows buying/selling pressure.
indicators.usage: > 80 = Overbought (Volume confirmed). < 20 = Oversold.

indicators.name: On-Balance Volume (OBV)
indicators.description: Uses volume flow to predict changes in stock price.
indicators.usage: Rising OBV confirms uptrend. Divergence (Price up, OBV down) warns of reversal.

indicators.name: VWAP (Volume Weighted Average Price)
indicators.description: The institutional benchmark for average price.
indicators.usage: Institutions buy below VWAP and sell above VWAP. Used as intraday support/resistance.

indicators.name: Volume Profile
indicators.description: Shows trading activity at specific price levels (Value Area).
indicators.usage: Point of Control (POC) acts as a magnet for price.

indicators.name: Chaikin Money Flow (CMF)
indicators.description: Measures the amount of Money Flow Volume over a period.
indicators.usage: Above 0 = Buying Pressure. Below 0 = Selling Pressure.

indicators.name: Accumulation/Distribution Line
indicators.description: Evaluates the cumulative flow of money into and out of an asset.
indicators.usage: A/D Line rising while price is flat = Accumulation (Bullish).

indicators.name: Fibonacci Retracement
indicators.description: Identifies strategic support and resistance levels.
indicators.usage: Key levels: 38.2%, 50%, 61.8% (Golden Ratio) act as support/resistance.

indicators.name: Pivot Points
indicators.description: Predictive indicators used to identify support and resistance.
indicators.usage: calculated from previous day's High, Low, Close. Used for day trading targets.

indicators.name: Linear Regression Slope
indicators.description: Measures the velocity of price change using statistics.
indicators.usage: Steep positive slope = Strong trend. Flat slope = Chop.

indicators.name: Fractals
indicators.description: Identifies reversal points based on repetitive patterns.
indicators.usage: Up fractal marks a potential top. Down fractal marks a potential bottom.

indicators.name: Z-Score
indicators.description: Measures how many standard deviations a price is from the mean.
indicators.usage: High positive Z-score = Statistically expensive. High negative = Cheap.

indicators.name: Correlation Coefficient
indicators.description: Analyzes how two different assets move in relation to each other.
indicators.usage: +1 = Perfect correlation. -1 = Inverse correlation. 0 = No correlation.

indicators.name: Market Breadth
indicators.description: Analyzes the number of advancing vs. declining stocks.
indicators.usage: Rising breadth confirms a healthy bull market.

indicators.name: Maximum Adverse Excursion (MAE)
indicators.description: Measures the largest unrealized loss during a trade.
indicators.usage: Used for post-trade analysis to optimize stop-loss placement.
